hints.content:
This circle is split into $4$ equal-sized pieces, or $\text{fourths}$, with $1$ piece shaded.  

![A circle divided into 4 equal parts. One part is shaded purple.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/dca6837f9d1f4e85f013c7daad1d1ab40b1f78c1)

This circle has one fourth of the shape shaded.

This circle is split into $2$ equal-sized pieces, or $\text{halves}$, with $1$ piece shaded.  

![A circle divided into 2 equal parts. One part is shaded blue.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3a48cece628a8e6085e240a0d535142af292a487)

The circle has one half of the shape shaded.

This circle is split into $3$ equal-sized pieces, or $\text{thirds}$, with $1$ piece shaded.  

![A circle divided into 3 equal parts. One part is shaded red.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/55c93b8d7853a67472f4762e85fd4bdb37248f01)

The circle has one third of the shape shaded.

This circle has one third of the shape shaded:

![A circle divided into 3 equal parts. One part is shaded red.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/55c93b8d7853a67472f4762e85fd4bdb37248f01)

question.content:
**Which circle shows one third of the shape shaded?**

choices.content: ![A circle divided into 2 equal parts. One part is shaded blue.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3a48cece628a8e6085e240a0d535142af292a487)
![A circle divided into 3 equal parts. One part is shaded red.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/55c93b8d7853a67472f4762e85fd4bdb37248f01)
![A circle divided into 4 equal parts. One part is shaded purple.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/dca6837f9d1f4e85f013c7daad1d1ab40b1f78c1)
